    LIST OF WORKS IN THE EXHBITION

    Below is a complete list of the 134 works displayed in the exhibition.


    Artists whose works are represented:
    Émile Bernard (French; 1868–1941)
    Paul Gauguin (French; 1848–1903)
    Vincent van Gogh (Dutch; 1853–1890)
    Utagawa Hiroshige (Japanese; 1797–1858)
    Katsushika Hokusai (Japanese; 1760–1849)
    Ogata Korin (Japanese; 1658–1716)

    Works are listed in chronological order; within each year, the works are listed by artist, in alphabetical order; Japanese works are listed at the conclusion. Effort has been made to provide titles used by the artists in correspondence, inventories, or exhibitions; these titles appear in French in parentheses.

    Dimensions are given in centimeters, height preceding width.

1880
    Paul Gauguin (French; 1848–1903)
    Wood Tankard and Metal Pitcher
    Paris, 1880
    Oil on canvas
    52.1 x 62.9 cm
    The Art Institute of Chicago, Millennium Gift of Sara Lee Corporation, 1999.362
1885
